articles.title: European Amazon Warehouse Staff Go on Black Friday Strike Against Working Conditions
articles.description: Some of Amazon's workers in Europe are protesting against what they call unfair work conditions, in a move meant to disrupt operations on Black Friday.
articles.content: Amazon Spain said around 90 percent of workers at a logistics depot in near Madrid joined a walkout Friday. Only two people were at the loading bay, spokesman Douglas Harper said. However, he said Amazon had diverted cargo deliveries to its other 22 depots in… [+628 chars]

articles.title: Poll Suggests Among Both Remain and Leave Voters May’s Brexit Deal Is Near Universally Unpopular
articles.description: A poll of British voters has revealed widespread discontent with the prime minister's Brexit deal, with more people saying it does not honour the 2016 referendum than saying it does, and many even arguing May's 'deal' is actually worse than the status quo.
articles.content: Some 43 per cent of Brits said Theresa May’s withdrawal deal struck with the European Union after over two years of first stalling then compromising failed to honour the result of the Brexit referendum in 2016, compared to just 19 per cent who said it did. A … [+3460 chars]

articles.author: Breitbart Jerusalem
articles.title: Israeli Attorneys File Class Action Lawsuit Against Airbnb for Delisting Settlements
articles.description: Four attorneys filed a class action suit against Airbnb in Jerusalem District Court on Thursday to protest the US-based company’s decision to drop listings in West Bank settlements from its vacation rental website that hosts ads from 191 countries.
articles.content: The law in Israel forbids discrimination based on the place where you live, and what Airbnb has done is by all means discrimination based on the place where you live, said attorney Aviel Flint, a partner in the law firm Yossi Levy & Co. This is a case of … [+229 chars]
